Dialogue.Value: (Being a Troglodyte, you can’t carry the crystal on your back. So you just stuff large chunks of it into your own body instead! You should be able to charge your body up in the Volcano.)
Ambraine is just an herb, right? Why is it so central to your city’s politics?
Only someone who has had Ethereal Dreams may perceive this foe...
Perhaps a sacrifice of Petrified Organs, Chromium Shards and Voltaic Vines will complete this statue...
Perhaps a sacrifice of 2 Vagabond Gelatin will do something here...
Perhaps a sacrifice of 8 Blue Sand will permit you to challenge the regrets of your bloodline...
(You feel a strange surge of wind blow through you. The Wind in the Caldera region recognizes you and will obey you if you command it)
A strange whispering Vortex splits the air here, showing shifting mirages...It seems unwise to touch this without the appropriate tool...

A strange whispering Vortex splits the air here, showing shifting mirages...Your Experimental Chakram sparks with greater energy than before...And it pulls you into the Vortex, through a void filled with flickering stars!

With a burst of power, the Vortex of shifting stars dissipates, and you briefly hear a wail of despair...The Experimental Chakram roars to life with newfound power, a smaller Vortex at its center! One final time, it hurls you through the mysterious void...
As you place the Warm Axe in the Charging Station you suddenly see it begin to glow! It focuses the heat of the Volcano into the Axe, until it sizzles with new power!

Lines of glowing white, yellow and magenta energy spiral through the fossils of this Calygrey Altar, humming a repeating melody...If you had some ambient power yourself and something that could mimic the melody it emits...Perhaps you could use this for something...

You play the Fossilized Greataxe trying to match the pattern...With a shudder, you feel the weapon tap into your Boons and draw their power into itself...A moment later, the Calygrey magic has restored the Greataxe to perfection!
Halloo there, small human! You keep your sharp steel in your bag, and give me shiny Silver, and you will get very nice goods!
Say...Do you think you could fix the silk banner on this fancy Halberd of mine?

Hmmm...Au! This is made of Ash Silk! Yes, I can fix it...IF you do something for us! There are exiled Ashborn out there, who causing great harm to innocents. You bring 3 of their Garnet Hearts to me, and then will I fix your banner, understand?
I have what you asked for!
Hmm...Good, give me a moment...
It is done! This is a very special weapon, little human! You treat it with more respect than the last owner, you understand me?
The tools of this smithy are still in good shape and no one is around to question you! You easily smash open the lock on the Smelly Sealed Box and retrieve the contents!
Au, a small one! I hope you enjoy steam bath too! It is a great place for me to think! As student of our Highmonk, he have much to teach me. Too much, I think...
Does this weird mace mean anything to you? I think it’s sealed with Giant Language...

Hmm...I think I can open this for you! ...Au....AU! Belonged to a cruel man, this did! One who used Giant’s Blood for horrible things! I should not have opened this...You go throw this weapon into the nearest ocean, human, if you have any sense!
The rusted spear’s rust cracks open with a horrifying shriek, revealing its true form!
Looks like the Ancient Dwellers got this poor Ash Giant...His body is coated with Petrified Stone Dust...
Your Slumbering Shield opens its mouth and gasps, sucking in the Petrified Dust that clings to you and the Giant! With a soft moan, it opens its eyes, revealing its true power!
There are holes in this statue, with red light shining from it...Perhaps you could repair it with an Amethyst Geode, a Voltaic Vine, and Petrified Organs...
(Insert the missing parts)
East road: Old Quarry South road: Sirocco City
East road: New Sirocco City South road: Old Sirocco Ruins
The Caldera will eat you alive if you’re unprepared, stranger. If you need anything, I’m sure we can settle on a fair price.
Au, another tired little bug! You need rest? You give me 50 Silver, and you can sleep here. We have very fancy beds, made by desert people! You like?
(The altar pulses with Corruption. You can feel the emotions within being tainted with the mindless desire to consume…)
Let’s get to work, then.
I’m not ready for this, I need a minute.
(You lay your hands on the Altar and focus as Oliele does her work. You can feel the memories begin to fill with rage...)
(An ancient looking tablet lies here. This is probably the one the Soroborean wanted.)
(Take it)
(Leave it)
(An ancient looking tablet lies here. It might be of interest to someone who is well traveled.)
(This looks like the stone tablet I was tasked to find. Let’s take it and bring it back.)
(This ornate granite tablet is covered in the symbols of an old language. It might be useful later.)
So tired... oh sorry! What may I help you with?

A Iocal mage keeps demanding more Cold Stones to make Ice Sigils. It’s such a pain to get blue sand from the Chersonese each time she comes around. Can you craft me a Cold Stone? To get the hag off my back?
It’s pretty simple to make a Cold Stone. Put a Mana Stone and some Blue Sand into an alchemy set and let it run. I’ll pay you real well if you bring me one!
Ahhh, thank you. Another week or so without that woman bothering me about these. Here, your reward.
This Forge Golem will stay a heap of junk until I find a way to fix it. Not easy to compete with the old master-artisans.
I’ll craft you armor from the Copal or Petrified Wood you bring me. Want some?
Helmet (2 Copal, 100 silver)
Armor (5 Copal, 200 silver)
Boots (2 Copal, 100 silver)
Helmet (2 Petrified Wood, 150 silver)
Armor (5 Petrified Wood, 250 silver)
Boots (2 Petrified Wood, 140 silver)
Copal Armor set.
Petrified Wood Armor set.
I’ve heard a Royal Manticore has made its lair in the region. Regular Manticores are terrifying enough!
Fresh fruits and meat! Grown right here inside the city!
The Manticores in this region have been breeding more than usual this year. Gabriella and her hunters can’t keep their numbers in check anymore!
If you think you can handle it, I’ll pay you a serious bounty for a Manticore's tail. Just don’t go picking a fight you can’t win, alright?
Everything is for sale, EVERYTHING! Even my mother... but no discounts on her!
If you ever pass through Monsoon, could you take this ledger to Lyda’s general store?
You’re the new member of the Aberdeen Family, right? The Sullivans have been kind enough to open up one of their old homes for your purchase.
Nice day, right?
So, interested in this house?
For a mere 500 silver coin, this house is yours!
Have a good day.
Very well. If you change your mind, you know where to find me.
That’s not enough coin. Come back later, with the money this time!
Welcome to your new home, my friend.
Don’t just stand there, dear! Come in and give those weary feet a rest!
Welcome to my inn! What can I do for you?
Travel safely!
You’ve already rented a room for the day! Go ahead and use it.
Of course! Renting a bed costs 25 silver.
See you soon!
Sorry, you don't have enough silver to stay here. Come back when you can afford it!
Your room is up the stairs, look for the open door. Sleep well!
I have items useful for hunters... whether you hunt beasts or men.
I came here to harvest Beast Golem Scraps. They’re very useful crafting components, but one of the golems injured my knee. So I’ll pay well if you bring me some Scraps.
Then, bring me 2 Beast Golem Scraps and I’ll reward you greatly.
This forest gifts us with the finest leather in all Aurai.
We protect the ancestral city of Berg. Is something troubling you?
It’s just along the main road. Look for the sign with the moon and star.

The smith is next to the entrance on a raised stone platform, and the other traders are down the main street. The hunter trainer is near the main entrance, and the rune sage studies near the Blue Chamber.
The Chamberlords of the many tribes of the Blue Chamber Collective come here regularly to discuss important business. The Blue Chamber itself is that massive building up on top of the hill.
The region has a tame climate and is home to Manticores and Beast Golems. Stay away from the old temple on the mountain, it’s crawling with horrors.
So long as you can pay for my medicine, I’ll see to it that you get what you need.
Hmm, I’m running a little low on Crystal Powder to brew advanced potions. If you’ve got an alchemy set of your own, make some for me, would you?
Ah, excellent! Here, your reward!
You know how to make Crystal Powder, right? Blend 4 Mana Stones in a deployed Alchemy Kit.
You don’t have what I need.
Thank you so much! Here, for your effort.
Good work. Here’s your well-earned reward! Remember, never go out in winter without proper attire!
Hello there [PlayerName]. Need some gear? I recommend our iron weapons and a bow, or a shield if you’re using a one-handed weapon.
Talk about what?
Certainly, lets do business!
Take good care of your equipment, friend. When wits fail you, your gear is all you can rely on out there.
Helmet (3 Blue Sand, 250 silver)
Armor (5 Blue Sand, 400 silver)
Boots (2 Blue Sand, 200 silver)
I can craft special armor from the Blue Sand you bring me. Want some?
Cierzo’s my favourite town in Aurai. The delicious fish, the sea breeze! But, back to business.
The freshest fish here! Caught just moments ago! Take a look!
I always loved the ceviche your parents made. I was never able to achieve the same taste! Could you prepare me a Cierzo Ceviche like your parents used to? I’ll return the favor!
You can gather all the ingredients on the beach in the Chersonese. You remember how it goes, right? A rainbow trout, sea weed and some salt in a great big pot?
The sea was generous today! Seafood and fish, all year round!
Business is slow for me whenever that Soroborean caravan comes in. Let me know if anything I have catches your eye!
Perfect, I was waiting for this. Here, your pay for a delivery well done.
Be sure to come back sometime, these deliveries are needed pretty regularly.
Are you planning to pass by Berg sometime soon? I have this ledger I need delivered to the Pleel’s general store. You'll be paid, of course, on delivery.
Excellent, thank you. Sharing information is essential for merchants like us. You’ll get your reward once you’ve delivered the ledger.
Where can I get some sleep?
Where can I find merchants and trainers?
Who’s important in this city?
Tell me about the surrounding region.
Hey, nice seeing you, [PlayerName]. The Cierzo militia can answer any questions you have.
The inn is the first building South of the gate. The entrance faces the city wall. Also, if you want clean water, go to the Water Purifier to the north-east of the beach.
Merchants are mostly clustered around the Fish Statue in the middle of the city. Our training area is on top of the raised docks, I’m sure you’ll find someone there with the time to mentor you.

The Chamberlady, Rissa Aberdeen is usually in her manor on top of the hill when she’s staying in Cierzo. Burac, the gate warden, is by the front gate. Oh, and Helen Turnbull is looking for curious objects, see her up on the raised deck near the inn.

If you want specifics, ask Burac, our gate warden. Generally speaking, winter can get unbearably cold, so wear thick clothing and keep torches and campfires on hand. And if you’re interested in magic, there’s a Ley Line under the Conflux Mountain, that large purple one in the middle of the region.
Well, if it isn’t [PlayerName]! Come on in! Having the usual?
Our supplies come from the four corners of Aurai. See anything you fancy?
It’s sad to see the old quarry full of bandits. I’m sure there are still some sand roses buried in those mines...
I can craft equipment from Hackmanite or Tsar Stones you bring me. What do you want?
Tenebrous Armor set
Tsar Armor set
Helmet (2 Hackmanite gems, 100 silver)
Armor (5 Hackmanite gems, 200 silver)
Boots (2 Hackmanite gems, 100 silver)
Helmet (3 Tsar Stones, 500 silver)
Armor (6 Tsar Stones, 1000 silver)
Boots (2 Tsar Stones, 300 silver)
Hey I recognize you! It’s a long way from Cierzo, isn’t it? What desires can I satisfy for you today?
I know exactly what you should wear, dear!
Shush. I have goods you won’t find anywhere else, but keep it on the down-low. The walls have ears and the guards have spears.
I was supposed to meet a trader today. He must’ve gotten lost in the desert! Could you find and rescue him with a Travel Ration?
Thank you, I’ll reward you for your service. Just remember to hurry, before he ends up as a dried corpse.
No word from them yet. They’re probably somewhere in Abrassar Desert.
Come back to me in a couple days, another shipment should come.
By now I think it’s too late. Oh well, another shipment should come in a couple days.
I owe you my life, friend. I’ll get these supplies to town and tell the big boss to reward you!
(This merchant is dead. You’re too late to do anything for him.)
F... food... Bandits stole my rations... Help.
(Give a travel ration.)
Arrg...
Innovative weapons and tools are my life! Whether for plowing or killing, my gear’s the best.
Everything is fresh! Come see our selection of daily produce and exclusive ingredients!
You look like the kind of person who would like some coins and doesn’t much care how you get them. Am I right?
I have a client who wants shark cartilage. Keep your mouth shut in front of the guards about it! They don’t like when we trade that stuff!
I heard the food store stocks contraband, the scumbag! Take your time to browse, only legit goods here!
I need this ledger delivered to the Doran’s general store in Cierzo. If you can make the journey, he’ll pay you well for it. Interested?
Welcome to the home of the, er, former baron! It’s up for sale, if you can afford it!
Ah, you’re [PlayerName], right? Her Majesty informed me that she’s granted you the house as a reward for your work. Here’s your key. Enjoy your new home!
Come in. Have a drink! Put your feet up and enjoy the endless festivities of the Heroic Kingdom!
Welcome to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant, home to all those who seek to become legend! What do you need?
The inn is close to the western entrance of the city. It’s the rounded building to either side of the star-plaza, with the lady and coralhorn deer statues.

Most merchants are in the middle of the city, the smith is south of the palace. The trainer is at the palace entrance, surrounded by training dummies and weapons. I’ve also heard that a thief is training people in the Slums...
The king and queen are in their palace to the east of the city. Just steer clear of the Slums to the city’s south. There’s a gate between us and them for a reason!

The heat’s merciless. Wear Desert Armor or take a Ice-Flame Torch with you. Stock up on water at a fountain before leaving the city. Ah, and use the open terrain to your advantage. You can spot trouble way in advance out here.
The rarest ingredients have never been so easy to obtain! See for yourself!
Weapons and armors are made by the strongest, for the strongest!
Need something else?
Browse shop.
Craft me something.
I can craft you armor parts from the palladium you bring me. What do you want?
Helmet (2 Palladium scrap, 300 silver)
Armor (5 Palladium scrap, 500 silver)
Boots (2 Palladium scrap, 250 silver)
Are you sure?
Come back to me later.
You don’t have the parts or funds I need to craft that armor piece.
I’m not done crafting your armor. Come back later!
There you go!
I always enjoy my visits to Monsoon! A true oasis inside a toxic marsh... Need anything to handle the danger outside?
I suggest our local Marshmelons! Picked fresh every day!
The best prices in Monsoon! Hurry up before its all gone!
Suul’s general store in Levant is in need of this ledger. If you’re passing by, could you deliver it? There’s some silver for you if you do!
If you’ve got the coin, you’ll find no greater comfort in this marsh than my inn. Pull up a seat!
In search of a new home? Look no more, this one is a bargain!
This is Monsoon, the divine city under Elatt’s protection. Need information, traveller?
Turn south when you reach the small blue auditorium, and walk up the hill. Keep your eye on the signs, eh?
Most of our shops are up on the roof of the central road here. Use the doors to get to the second floor. The training district is on the large platform just south of the temple.
The lotus temple is the place to go to find the Cardinal of the Holy Mission. Chamberlord Lockwell is across the bridge west of the temple.

Stay out of the marsh water, it’ll poison you. Carrying Marsh Antidotes out here is a smart move. Also, be wary of the Ash Giant village in the north-east, and around the Lich’s Spire in the south-west.
Yes.
No.
No, thanks.
I’d like to talk.
I want to buy something.
Nothing.
Deal, here’s your money.
I want a room, please.
I’m leaving.
Not now.
Farewell.
I'm fine, thank you.
I want to train with you.
(There is nothing I can do with that right now.)
I won’t need your help for a few days, but be sure to come again when I’ll have work for you.
I’m here to collect my armor piece.
(There is a book here.)
(There is a note lying here.)
(Read it.)
(Leave it.)
I am sorry, [PlayerName], but this isn’t your home anymore. The town guards are using it as a barracks at the moment.
That said, we really don’t need to. We have more than enough room in the original barracks. I’ll tell you what, you donate 300 silver, and we’ll let you have your home back.
Hah, I told the guys you ain’t a deadbeat! Alright, here’s the key to your home. Enjoy. We tried to leave as much of it untouched as we could.
Well, your call. If you’re looking for a place to spend the night, the inn is still open for you.
Well, fancy running into you out here! What can I do for you?
[PlayerName]! A courier came by looking for you. Rissa wants to speak to you in Berg next time you pass by!
Ah, [PlayerName]! A missionary just dropped in. He said someone’s looking for you out in Monsoon next time you’re in the area.
Hey! [PlayerName]! A courier just sent word. Someone’s asking for you all the way out in Levant, and hopes to see you next time you’re there. You really get around, don’t you?
Greetings, [PlayerName] Aberdeen! Rissa Aberdeen is looking for you! She should be by the old tomb in the city square!
Are you [PlayerName]? A missionary from Monsoon just came by. She said someone’s asking for you back home next time you’re in the area.
You’re [PlayerName], right? Someone sent a courier from Levant for you. Apparently someone’s looking for you back home the next time you’re in Abrassar!
[PlayerName] Aberdeen? A courier just got here from Berg. Someone’s looking for you there. Next time you’re in Enmerkar, let them know you’re alright.
Ah, [PlayerName]! Ellinara out in front of the temple was asking for you. She says she has work for you!
[PlayerName]! There you are! Cardinal Bourlamaque in the Temple was looking for you. He said it was important!
Hold there a minute! Are you [PlayerName]? A courier from Levant came looking for you. Next time you’re in Abrassar desert, be sure to look into it!
You’re [PlayerName], right? Word just came from Berg, someone’s looking for you. Check in on them next time you’re there, eh?
Ah, [PlayerName], from the Holy Mission! Monsoon sent word for you. Next time you’re in the Hallowed Marsh, you should check in with them!
[PlayerName]! Cyrene said to pass word along that she’s got work for mercenaries like yourself! If you’re looking for coin, you should ask her what she has planned!
[PlayerName]! There you are! The King and Queen summon you for an audience! It seems like they have a serious request for you!
Take care, traveller. It’s not safe out there.
Greetings. I hope you’re well!
I’m afraid I’m quite busy, perhaps some other time.
As a reward for your service, I’ll sell you exclusive goods made by my master. Naturally, these transactions will remain strictly between us.
I want to have my equipment repaired.
For 50 Silver, I can do it for you.
I am sorry but you don't have enough silver.
You want to learn how to hunt? I’ll teach you how to be a predator.
Runic magic is versatile and intricate, letting you summon weapons, place arcane traps on the ground and far more.
Amba, my friend! Ready to continue your training?
A visitor! The Cabal shares its wisdom with those who respect the Five Winds. Reason, Passion, Fury, Kindness and the Inside Wind.
To use the spells I teach, find the Wind Totems in every region. Then, you may use these spells in that region. The totems are topped by a bird statue, you’ll recognize them.
Being a mercenary means hardship, from fighting monsters to wearing damn full plate in the desert. It also means freedom and profit!
Empty your mind, be formless, like shadow. Shadow can take any form and overcome any army. Be smart, be shadow, my friend.
I assume you wish to learn magic from me... You don’t look like the type that’s interested in actual philosophy.
Patience and fearlessness allows you to win against any enemy, but honed techniques help too.
I’m calling in a Tribal Favor. Teach me, please.
Hey there. Watch yourself in the swamp. Drop your guard and you’ll see what the inside of a Tuanosaur’s stomach looks like.
I can teach you the Moon Swipe. It’s a sweeping technique for Polearms that deals with enemies attacking from all sides. It’ll cost 50 silver. Interested?
Excellent. Let’s step outside and I’ll show you. Use your shoulder to generate most of the momentum-
And that's how you do it. Here's hoping it saves your life out there!
Ever been to the Jade Quarry in the Marsh’s south? It’s overrun by vermin now that the jade is gone. There might still be something else of value there, though.
If you want a simple spell, I can teach you the Flamethrower spell for the price of 50 silvers. You only need to hold a lantern or a torch, and you’ll be ready to use it.
Smart choice. Rather than using Spark to detonate the air, try “pushing” the air inside your lantern. It will unleash a torrent of flames on any who dare cross you.

Ah, you can tell I’m a dabbler in the magic arts? I can teach you how to give yourself a Boon of Warmth. It gives you resistance to flames and heat, while increasing the damage your own flames do. Does 50 Silver sound fair?
Alright, to start with, try gathering the heat around you by reaching out with your-
And with that, you'll have a Boon of Warmth. It's very helpful while exploring the desert during daylight.

I can teach you to gain mastery over the cold. A Boon of Cool will allow you to resist the cold and frost, and increase the power of your own ice magic. I’ll teach you for 50 silver, so we can bring in something to eat that’s not damn Turmmips!
Yes! I can already taste the Luxe Lichette! So, to cast the Boon of Cool, you pull in any source of cold around you-
And that's how you generate the Boon. It may be helpful to ward off the winter cold, but it's no substitute for warm clothes and a campfire.
For 50 silver, I can teach you a spell to summon a Boon of Blessing. It will protect you from the light and lightning magic from your opponents, and increase the power of your own. Interested?
Alright, sit down. First, we must consider the relation that light and lightning have with one another and-
Hey, now! Don't fall asleep on me! Well, at any rate, I think you've gotten the hang of the Bless Boon. Now, I finally have to money to buy that new alchemy set!
What could I teach a human... Ah, I know. I can teach you a way to become resistant to Decay magic and poisons, and make your own far more powerful. I call it the Possession Boon.
Teach it to me, please.
Sit and close your eyes. I will help you unlock the power to manipulate the Corruption that lurks within you.
-There. The queasiness will fade shortly. ... Ugh, that took a lot out of me... I hope you find the Possession Boon spell useful, human.
Then is there something else that you need?

I do know of an interesting spell that I could pass down. It’s quite helpful in this ghost-filled region. The Mist Boon. It will protect you from ghostly or ethereal attacks, and make your own ethereal damage more powerful. How does 50 silvers sound?
Deal. Let’s get started. First, we need to understand the nature of ghosts as a whole. They are-
Yes, exactly, you've got it! With the Mist Boon, you will be more protected from ghosts, and if you have something like Spiritual Varnish coated on your weapon, you will destroy ghosts with ease.
Yes, I can teach you a little Kazite trick. I can teach you a way to use a one-handed axe to cripple and slow your enemies! Is 50 silvers a fair price?
It’s very simple. Everyone keeps their defenses up to protect their vulnerable head. Take advantage of this and aim low. You’d be surprised at how nasty a wound to the ankle can be!
Amba, friend [PlayerName]! I continue to train every day so that someday I can fill Eto’s boots and protect Cierzo! Maybe we should train together, eh?

I made a trip to visit the old Hermit in the valley beyond the Ghost Pass. It’s a dangerous journey, but his knowledge of magic is vast. To learn the spells of the Cabal of Winds, there is no better teacher.
It’s gonna run you 50 silvers, but I can teach you a technique. It’s a short strike with a lethal twist that inflicts a lasting pain on the victim. Real useful to shank someone who owes you money.
Ok, then, put ‘em up, and I’ll show you how it’s done!
Perfect. The key is to jam your sword up and under their armor if you can. Use one sharp jab and then twist hard!
I’ll teach you a Mace Infusion technique for 50 silvers. It negates an enemy’s elemental attack and imbues your mace with it. It doesn’t even require Mana to use!
This may take some explaining. Mana is a “flow”, so you must carefully catch the spell by-
And that's how you use an opponent's elements against them!

If you pay me, sure, I’ll give you a private lesson. You wanna know the most effective way to finish off a opponent with a 2-handed axe once you’ve got them on the floor? Pay my tab for tonight, it’s 50 silver, and I’ll teach you.
Alright, come with me. We’re going to go practice this on a couple of old logs. Here, I’ll even let you use my axe!
Hah, there you go, you’ve gotten the hang of it! Remember, while you turn for extra momentum, you should step forward and put your full weight into it!
Of course. If you’d like a defensive technique with a 2-handed sword, I’d teach you the Pommel Counter. It’ll leave your foes confused. That lesson costs 50 Silver.
Hold the blade horizontally. Strike back with the flat of the blade. Then bash them with the pommel before they can react!
If you favor two-handed maces, you may learn the slow but powerful Juggernaut Strike. I can teach you, provided you donate 50 silvers to our temple.
Alright, first take a firm stance, plant your feet and pull your mace back. Then once all your weight is on your back foot swing all that weight into a single upwards motion. Here, let me show you...
Gah! Good hit! You've got a good handle on that skill now! Remember, it takes time to pull off. Be sure your blow will connect before you use it!
You want to learn from the king? Buy me a couple rounds at the inn, say about 50 silvers worth, and I’ll teach you my ultimate technique: Simeon's Gambit.
Step outside and I’ll show you. First, you begin by baiting your foe with a low stance and prepare to counter it with a-
And if they don’t fall for it, jab really quick at their shoulder height. You have no idea how often that catches people by surprise!
What is it you wish to talk about?
Can you teach me the basics of rune combination?

Runes are a highly flexible form of magic, and experimentation will be necessary. For beginners, a Lexicon is required to be held in the caster’s off-hand, as each rune has a multitude of meanings depending on their context.

Runes typically linger upon the caster after they're invoked. In order to create a tangible effect, one must cast a combination of runes in a set order. If a combination isn't valid, nothing will happen.

A simple spell is the Runic Blade, which forms a sword of pure mana that is naturally imbued with the Ethereal power. First, you must cast the Shim Rune, followed by the Egoth rune. Dropping the weapon will cause it to return to nothingness.

For those who are part of a prominent family that has earned my trust, like the Aberdeens and the Sutherlands, I can offer to teach you how to Internalize the Lexicon so that you no longer need one to cast rune spells.
Can you teach me how to do advanced rune combinations?

Very well, now that you understand the fundamentals of Advanced Runes, I can teach you how to put them into practice. Some rune combinations are effective only after another rune combination has been activated.

For example, once you have cast a Runic Trap spell and it lies ready on the floor, perform “Shim”, then “Shim” again to create a Runic Blast that will detonate around you. Nearby foes will be harmed, but you won't!

It’s a useful spell if your enemy evades your trap and is bearing down on you. Very few foes expect such a trick from a mage. Many more combinations like this exist with other Runic spells, and only through thoughtful experimentation can one reveal them.

I would if I could, but to actually perform an advanced rune spell, you will need to learn the fundamental theory of advanced runes. Once I have taught them to you, ask me again and I can teach you one of those combinations.
I’m having trouble understanding how to make combinations. Is there a shortcut you can teach me?

Ahh...It goes against my every teaching, but I suppose I can teach you one dirty little trick, on one of two conditions. I crave Diadème de Gibier. It’s been years since I’ve had a bite of that exquisite desert dish...
Bring me some Diadème de Gibier and I’ll teach you that little trick. Or, I suppose if the Collective owes you a Tribal Favor, I can make an exception to my rules and teach you.
Listen well, then. Mages came to the conclusion that each of the four runes are spells that are only useful when building runic combinations.

Welcome to Outward’s tutorial. Follow the red line to learn about the game’s mechanics.
You can bypass parts of the tutorial by not following the red line.

Press [InputAction_LockToggle] to lock your camera on an enemy, allowing you to hit him more easily.
Press [InputAction_LockToggle] again to remove the lock.
Head down to learn about basic combat.

Perform attacks with [InputAction_Attack1] and special attacks with [InputAction_Attack2].
The number of attacks you make before making a special attack will change which strike you will make.

Evade attacks by dodging with [InputAction_Dodge], though this consumes a fair amount of Stamina.
You can also move away from attacks by holding [InputAction_Sprint] to Sprint.

Your stability bar is at the bottom of the screen while enemies have it under their health bar.
When one’s stability reaches 50%, he is knocked back; when it reaches 0%, he is knocked down.

To assign skills or items to quickslots, open the menu with [InputAction_ToggleInventory], then select the Quickslot tab and assign them there. [Gamepad_Specific]To use quickslots with a gamepad, press the assigned button while holding [InputAction_QuickSlotToggle1] or [InputAction_QuickSlotToggle2].
Proceed up the stairs to learn about skills.

Most spells require items in your inventory or an effect active on you.
Take some Fire Stones on the table, so you can cast Fire Sigils. Take Astral Potions to replenish your Mana.

First, put the Spark and Fire Sigil skills in your quickslots, and be certain to have Fire Stones in your inventory.
Cast a Fire Sigil then use Spark while standing inside the sigil.

Assign the Enrage and Predator Leap skills to your quickslots.
Use Enrage to gain the Rage boon and only then you can use Predator Leap, since the leap requires having Rage active on you.

Status effects are displayed at the bottom left of the screen.
Removing negative effects is important between battles. For example, Bleeding deals damage over time, and is healed with Bandages.
Proceed to learn about Food and Drink, which are two of the character’s needs.

Appease your thirst and hunger, or you will pass out.
Animals and plants provide food, while bodies of water can quench your thirst, though you will need a waterskin to carry water with you.

Cook your meat and boil your water so as not to become ill.
It takes a long time to recover from illness, though medicinal teas can help.

To cook in the wild, you must craft Campfire Kits.
Gather 3 Wood from the nearby tree, enter your menu with [InputAction_ToggleInventory], go to the Crafting tab and select a Campfire Kit.

Once you have a Campfire Kit, go to your Inventory and use it. You can then deploy the Campfire on the ground.
If you have a Flint and Steel in your Inventory, interact with the Campfire to light it.

Cooking with a single ingredient only requires a lit campfire. Recipes with multiple ingredients require a Kitchen or a Cooking Pot deployed on a fire.
You can use a Cooking Pot in your inventory and place it on a Campfire.
Proceed down to learn about managing your temperature in extreme climates.

In hot climates, drink water and wear clothing tailored to protect against the sun.
Heavy armors rarely protect against the heat, though.

In cold climates, campfires and torches can warm you up.
Padded or fur-lined clothes also protect against the cold.
Proceed to learn about managing your inventory capacity.

Even with a backpack, you cannot take all the items you will find.
Equipment is quite heavy and even coins have weight.

Equipment breaks during combat, becoming less effective. Lanterns burn out while they are lit, and can be refilled by using Crafting. Food rots with time, even when you are resting or travelling to another region.

Backpacks increase your inventory capacity but usually slow down your dodge.
You can drop your backpack with [InputAction_HandleBag] before combat, then pick it back up after the fight has ended.

Lanterns in your backpack, and not in your pouch, are hung from your backpack, freeing your off hand for a shield or a two-handed weapon.
Open and close lanterns with [InputAction_ToggleLights].

Proceed forward to learn about Resting.
Sleep is another of your character’s needs.

Sleeping, either in an inn or in a tent, removes tiredness and restores health.
It also restores maximum health, which is lowered by taking damage, and maximum stamina, which is lowered by performing strenuous actions.

After you’ve finished resting, enemies can ambush you.
Guarding lowers the chance that this occurs. Where you decide to rest also impacts how likely it is you will be attacked.

Repairing restores the durability of your weapons and armor.
Note that only your currently equipped items will be repaired.
Use the door to exit the Tutorial and return to the Main Menu.

Blocking with [InputAction_Block] prevents the damage from a strike and reduces how much you would be knocked back.
Shields consume less stamina when blocking and can block arrows.
Physical skills often require you to wield a specific weapon type or to have a Status Effect active on you, such as the Rage Boon.
Use this elevator to reach the section on negative Status Effects.

Other items can help manage your temperature, such as potions, tents or meals.
You can also seek shelter underground, where the temperature is usually moderate.

I can’t believe that Old Levant is demanding we cede control of Abrassar to them! If it weren’t for Calixa and Simeon, this place would still be the hunting grounds of the Devourer! They should be thanking us on bended knee!

And now it looks like the Blue Chamber will blame us for the attack on Berg! Why don’t they bother to enforce the law in their own lands?! They’ve had that gang of bandits running loose in the burnt forest of Enmerkar for months!
It’s surprising how people in the slums are sometime more aware of what happens in the city than us. I wonder how many of them have their hands in criminal enterprises, to be so well informed.

I hear that bandit activity is on the rise in Abrassar. While I’m not one to cheer on criminals, it feels like justice. Levant’s armies loot and pillage every village they besiege! They’re no better than bandits, if you ask me!

You’re looking for “The Slide”? There’s two entrances, one near those abandoned ships, and another one somewhere further south. I hear the tunnel gets a little narrow...you may need to crawl to get through.
Sorry, but if you want to order a meal, you can only get half a portion. We’re facing a famine with no idea when things will get better. I worry for the slums. They’ve been the hardest hit.

I just saw a Soroborean caravan come in with these giant tanks of water, with entire Marshmelon plants inside! I don’t know how they pulled that off, and I don’t care. The famine is over! Full course meals for everyone!
I hear that Levant has been hit by famine! Hopefully this leads to an end to the war... I hear their armies are pillaging every village they come across just to feed themselves!
What would I do without that Soroborean Caravan coming from Harmattan every few weeks? He always seems to have precisely what I need, no matter how rare or unusual!
The very palace besieged by our own army! This is terrifying! I hope the King and Queen are alright!
We’re going to need a lot more deliveries of wine if all these toasts to our new goddess keep up. It’s an incredible time to be alive, to witness something like this in our own city!

You’re looking for Yzan? “High and dry, where the boats used to be tied” huh? Well, there was an old set of docks up on a cliff where those ships are stranded. Give that a try... it’s in the north of Abrassar.

How is your attempt to pay off your Blood Price going? You’d better find that silver if you don’t want to lose your home! Oh! That reminds me, Helen Turnbull was around here, she said she was looking to hire someone for a job!
It’s also possible that some survivors of the wreck washed up on a beach further out in the Chersonese. If you could save one of them, I’m sure they’d return the favor.
Life’s going to be really quiet here without Yzan, Oliele and Rissa. They all asked you to come with them, right? Maybe you should take one of them up on their offer. What do you have to lose?

Oh! You look like the one that Rissa Aberdeen said she was planning to adopt into her family! Everyone in Berg is talking about it! New blood in such a prestigious bloodline could really change things in the Blue Chamber Collective!

What brings you to Monsoon, traveller? Are you thinking of joining the Holy Mission of Elatt? They could always use more dedicated people. I’ve been hearing more and more customers doubt in Elatt’s goals... It’s keeping me up at night.

You’re planning to become a Citizen of Levant, aren’t you, traveller? You’ve come at a difficult time. The slums are packed to bursting with new people, and we’re dealing with increasing bandit raids. I fear one more crisis will topple this entire house of cards!
I’m looking to join the Blue Chamber Collective, how do I get there from here?
I’m looking to Join the Holy Mission, how do I get there?
I want to join the Heroic Kingdom of Levant, how to I get there?
First, you need to head to Enmerkar forest. Head east past the Conflux Mountain, and keep watch for the Chersonese’s Vigil crystal. Head south of it and you’ll find the road to the forest.

In Enmerkar, stay on the north side of the lake and head east as you look for the stone walls of Berg, built into the northern mountain walls. But be wary! Manticores often hunt in that forest. They’re the region’s apex predator for good reason.

In Enmerkar, head East and past the stone city of Berg. Once you leave the stone walls and the lake behind, head north past a small stone archway. You’ll find the road to the Hallowed Marsh not much farther from there.
In Enmerkar, head south-east and past the lake. On the far eastern side of the forest, near the vigil, you’ll find the road to Abrassar Desert, the home of Levant.

First, you need to reach the Hallowed Marsh. Head east, past the Conflux Mountain. When you see the Chersonese’s Vigil crystal, make sure you pass north of it. The road to the Marsh is along that way.

When you reach the Hallowed Marsh, follow the Pilgrim Road. It’s what we call that trail of luminous sun-pillars that leads to Monsoon. If you lose the trail somehow, head north, following the giant ray of light above Monsoon, and you’ll get there eventually.

When you reach Abrassar desert, head east and look for the glowing city on top of a great hill, and you’ll have reached Levant. You may want to stop at the Oasis at the entrance of the desert to re-stock on water while you’re at it.

Unfortunately, there is no Pilgrim Road you can follow in the Hallowed Marsh from Enmerkar. You’ll have to manage on your own, following the Light Ray above Monsoon in the north until you reach the city.

Worse still, the Light Mender Lich has gotten very territorial. Getting past his Spire in the south may be very dangerous, unless you bypass it via the old flooded Ziggurat Tunnel. If this sounds too nasty for you, try getting there from the Chersonese.

In Enmerkar, go straight north. If you see the lake, you’re going the wrong way. Just go as north as you can, until you pass under a little stone arch, and then keep going until you reach the Hallowed Marsh.
To leave Abrassar desert, head as west as you can go. There’s an oasis not far from the road out of here where you can resupply your water, and maybe some berries, if you’re lucky.

Getting to Enmerkar Forest is very tricky from here. You’ll need to head east past the Vigil crystal, and then go south as far as you can go. You can try to use the Light Mender’s spire as a landmark, although it’s not perfectly reliable.
If you get to Enmerkar from the Marsh, go south, and then west as soon as you can. Take the first bridge you see, and you should find one of Berg’s gates right in front of you.
If you get to Enmerkar from the Marsh, walk south then east. The city will be just north of the river.
Once you reach Enmerkar, head north and then west, and take a bridge across the lake. Look for a city with stone walls built into the mountainside. That’s Berg, home of the Blue Chamber Collective.

You have evidence of a plot against the Holy Mission? I can think of several people who will want to hear about this! Rissa Aberdeen at the town square, Sagard Battleborn here at the inn, Cyril Turnbull at the Blue Chamber, and Mathias at his home near the inn.
Oh, you’re looking for Jager Sullivan too? He’s usually standing at the door of his house by the West Gate, across from the farm. Look for the man with the face mask.
There are still enemies here, [PlayerName]!
Thank you for saving me, [PlayerName]. The entirety of the Blue Chamber Collective is in your debt. I’m glad I can still count on you.
Ah! [PlayerName]! You made it! Welcome, my friend, to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant!
Well, look what the sand swept in. My favourite bandit. What brings you to my city, [PlayerName]?
I'm just passing through.
Enjoy your stay, then, my friend.
Sure, fine. Just be aware that in this city, thieves get locked up outdoors in the sun. Unless you’re looking for a nasty tan, behave yourself.
(Give 50 Silver) I’m sorry about earlier. Here, I’ll pay you back, plus interest.
Maybe there’s some hope for you after all. Fine. It’s in the past now.
I want to join Levant.
I suppose even I can't turn my nose up at an extra pair of hands, even when they're known to steal from me.
Good to hear! We could always use someone who knows what they're doing.
You will need someone with high status to vouch for you if you want to stay. We're facing an overpopulation crisis and we need to be sure our new people are actually useful.

You should try Cyrene, by the entrance to the Palace, she'll approve you if you can help our army. Or you can always make a deal with Sir Montgomery, the Baron of the slums. He's usually outside his manor.
(Say nothing.)
You’ve gotten approval from someone? Perfect. Now go to the palace and request citizenship from Queen Calixa. She doesn’t refuse those who’ve been vouched for.
Oh, wonderful, another mouth to feed. We need mercenaries who can handle the dangers of the desert, not refugees.
Show me that you’re a mage, and I’ll give you my approval. We could always use more people who know how to use Mana. You know how to unlock the power of Mana, right?
Hmm, you'll do. If you can survive the journey to the Ley Line, you're not some helpless refugee. I'll vouch for you on behalf of Levant's army. Queen Calixa will be glad to let you stay.
Here, If you’re going to be doing mercenary work for me, I think you might need these. The mercenary across from me can teach you how to use it, if you don’t know how already.
Your request to join the Heroic Kingdom has been approved. All that’s left is for you to introduce yourself to the royal family.
Go to the Conflux Mountain in the Chersonese. That large purple one. Up along the side of the mountain is a passage with our flag beside it. Use that to get inside and down to the Ley Line.
A visitor, huh? Behave yourself in my city, or you’ll end up locked in the open-air cage in the slums.
You must be that one that Yzan was talking about from Cierzo. Square things with him first, and then maybe we can talk. He’s down by the fountain near the Inn.
I have nothing to say to you, priest. If you’re not here to help us win the war, I have no use for you.
You must be the one that Yzan told me about. Yzan, deal with them, would you?
A new refugee, hmm? I'm Baron Montgomery. So long as you pay your dues, you're welcome to stay, as far as I'm concerned.
You look like the adventurous type. If you bring me 200 silver coins, I'll vouch for you and give you a place to stay. That's a better deal than a lot of people can hope for these days.
Excellent. Here's a letter of introduction for our Queen. She'll arrange for your citizenship. Oh, and here. Your place to stay. Find a stretch of ground that's not occupied and roll that out.
Hey now, what's with that look? I kept up my end of the deal, didn't I? You should show some gratitude!
Shoo, now. You have your approval to become a citizen of Levant. Once you’ve introduced yourself to the Queen, it’s a done deal.
Ah, a visitor! Be sure to buy lots of things from the local shops, their prices are excellent, if I do say so myself!

Your face isn't familiar to me. You must be new to Levant. Welcome to the Heroic Kingdom, where our hope is to give every person the chance to do what they excel at, and the chance to live the life they wish to live.
I am King Simeon, and this is my Queen, Calixa. My gut tells me that you’re skilled in survival. I’m sure you’ll be a great asset as a mercenary.
We are constantly under threat by the beasts and bandits of the desert. If you can help us, we are overjoyed to have you.
Will you, [PlayerName], pledge your service to the ideals of the Heroic Kingdom of Levant? To help us create a place where humankind can do more than just survive?
I don’t think I’m the right person for this. Sorry.
I pledge myself to the Heroic Kingdom.
Excellent. The Heroic Kingdom of Levant is happy to have you, citizen. If you’re looking for work, I’m sure Cyrene has plenty that pays well.
That’s a shame. If you change your mind, the kingdom will be waiting.
(This is a turning point in my life... Am I certain I wish to pledge my life to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant?)
I am sorry, but unless you have official business here, I do not have the time to spare for a visitor.
Ah, so you must be the new one we’ve been informed about. Welcome to the Heroic Kingdom of Levant.
I’d enjoy swapping stories with you, traveler, but Calixa and I are discussing what should be done about the old Sand Rose Quarry. Perhaps later.
I apologize for my selection, but we’re, ummm, understocked on everything.
Don’t get your hopes up too much, there’s, ah... pretty large taxes on my goods.
If I could offer you a better deal, I would. But it’s out of my control, I’m afraid.
I’m sorry if the price of goods is a little higher than usual, it’s not something I have control over when selling goods in Levant.
Oh, well hello there, traveler. I hope you enjoy the sights and sounds of the Heroic Kingdom of Levant. I’m Kirouac. Alchemist, politician, and philosopher.

I’m the one who convinced King Simeon and Queen Calixa to declare Levant to be a nation outside the Blue Chamber’s laws. Not one of us regrets it. Here, anyone can be free to pursue their dreams without Tribal Laws restricting them!
Look out! There’s still criminals in here, you dolt!
Thank you! These damn criminal scum kidnapped me straight from the Blue Chamber and hauled me here in a sack!
Here, I have to reward you for this. I’ve got 100 silver on me, and by my Queen you deserve every last one of them! Now if you’ll excuse me, I need to get back to Berg and try to sort this mess out!
I'm sorry that was the first thing you woke up to, [PlayerName]. Please, forgive them. Many of them have lost family and are not thinking straight.
I can't believe they want to seize my home! Can't you do something?

If I could do more, I would. The most I can do for you is declare a mourning period and buy you a little time. If you do not pay off those 4 months of missed payments on your own, the tribe would have my head. For 5 days, no one in the tribe can ask for what you owe.
That gives you 5 days to pay back all 150 silver coins. Either gather the money or earn a Tribal Favor, and they won’t be able to touch you.
Once you can make the payment, come see me up at the town hall on top of the hill. Please, find a way to make it work, [PlayerName]. The last thing I want to do is take your lighthouse away.
How can I earn a Tribal Favor so quickly?
One sailor is still missing. The current may have pushed him to the shore of the southern beach. If you bring him alive…well, the Tribe would owe you a great favor.
You're planning to use the tunnel under the lighthouse storage area to save time, aren't you? Make sure you're prepared for the outside world first if you do.
Someone saw Troglodytes in there last night. Also, once you leave those tunnels, you can’t use them to return to Cierzo.
I can't possibly accomplish that! I need more time!

A dozen people lost their lives in that shipwreck, leaving grieving kin behind. Their need outweighs yours. Trust me, [PlayerName], I wouldn’t be doing this to you otherwise. Their families need the assistance immediately.
You must find a way to pay what is owed to the tribe. The last thing I want is confiscate your home.
This Blood Price is unfair! You can't hold me responsible for things that are out of my control!

Have you forgotten why your family bears this Blood Price? When your grandmother was Chamberlady, she turned away the followers of Elatt in our time of greatest need, forcing the tribe to pray only to the Five Winds for protection.
Because of her pride, dozens were slain by the beasts of the Scourge. Your bloodline owes it to them to pay back that debt!
I understand. Bitterness still runs very deep in the tribe.
If you understand, then get to work making that payment, [PlayerName].
How could I possibly forget? Not a day goes by without someone reminding me!
You live and breathe thanks to the deeds of your ancestors. You cannot embrace such a gift if you cannot also bear the costs of their actions.
I can't bear this stupid Blood Price any longer. What if I just leave and never come back?
If you think you can survive alone, out there in the wild, you have that right. But remember, your tribe is your family. We achieve more together than we do on our own.
Then I will have to head outside the walls.
That does seem like your most effective option, dangerous as it is. I doubt you'd be able to gather that much in such a short time just by staying in Cierzo.
Never forget, no one is an orphan in Cierzo. Do not hesitate to ask the rest of the tribe for survival advice. Though you owe us a Blood Price, we will still help you however we can.
If you can do a great deed for someone in Cierzo, we will owe you a Tribal Favor, which I will accept as a substitute for your payment.
Once you're ready to leave Cierzo, speak with Burac, the Gate Warden. He will judge whether or not you are prepared to face the outside world.
Remember, [PlayerName], you only have 5 days to pay me the 150 silver, or show me proof you have earned a Tribal Favor . May your ancestors watch over you.
Who would be able to help me?
Eto is the Kazite Trainer. He can teach you about combat. Burac, the gate warden, can teach you about surviving out in the wild. I’m sure the shopkeepers can teach you about their expertise as well.
[PlayerName], how go your efforts?
I want to talk about my Blood Price.
If you’re looking for news the Inn is always a good place to try, and don't forget about Yzan down by the beach!
I have questions about our tribe.
What do you wish to know?
What are your duties as Chamberlady? I never have paid much mind to politics.
I represent us within the Blue Chamber Collective, whenever the tribes need to make a decision that affects us all. Each of us bears one vote on the matters at hand.
Should a Chamberlord call a meeting, we gather in the city of Berg, the birthplace of our Collective, and hold a discussion, then a vote.

As such, I wield much power within the town of Cierzo, but only so long as my decisions are accepted. After all, your grandmother was Chamberlady once, before she was exiled for her actions. No one in the Collective is above the law.
You’re always trying to look after me. Why?

As children, your Father and I were close. I saw a future for us... but he could not stand by as the woman who would be your mother bore the weight of your grandmother's sins alone. There’s only so much a single huntress can manage.
They turned into a natural team, working to redeem your bloodline. I must admit, she was better suited for him... despite it all, we remained close friends.
You may not be connected to me by blood or tradition, but I still consider you family, [PlayerName]. I don’t want to see you suffer.
Enough talk about the past.
I’m on my way, farewell, Lady Aberdeen.
Ancestors guide you, [PlayerName]. Be safe. Be smart.
And on time, too! I'm impressed, [PlayerName]. You've proven you can be an excellent asset to the tribe when you put your mind to it.
I'll see that this money gets to the families that need it most. Thank you for your efforts.
Well done. Consider this payment dealt with. Cierzo thanks you for your great deed.
You have a way to make that payment, [PlayerName]? Show me.
I have 150 silver right here.
I earned a Tribal Favor.
[PlayerName], I'm afraid that you came too late. The lighthouse has been sold and is used by the guards as a barrack.
Come on! I worked like a dog to earn that money! This isn't fair!
If you cannot succeed at a task, then you must accept the price of failure. This is one of life's most important lessons.
Well, I tried.
That you did, [PlayerName]. Even though the payment was late, you've proven you can survive in Aurai.
Lesson learned, then. I need to be more efficient.
Indeed. The world will not wait for you. Either move at Aurai's pace, or you will be left behind.
Great, I'm homeless now. Thanks for nothing as usual, Rissa.
Bitterness won't do you any good. The world will not wait for you. Besides, you learned how to survive on your own, like a bird pushed from its nest.
Greetings, [PlayerName], how are you?
[PlayerName], I wish I could greet you with a smile, but... well, we both know that won’t happen. Elatt’s breath, what a disaster...
How are you holding up?
Yesterday I was leading our most ambitious expedition in a decade. Now all that's left is this wreck and a tribe in mourning. I’m not holding up much better than you are.
What happened? How did our ship sink so close to home?
The lighthouse wasn’t lit at the time we made impact with the rocks, I’m certain. I remember thinking that we should have seen it by now, right before we hit the rock.
We lost everyone below deck... Half the ship came apart before I was able to run aground.
Such is the way of the world...
Aye. And we can either bow to it, or rise against it. I know which one I'd rather do.
So we lost everything? All the coins? The spices? The armor and weapons?
Unfortunately, yes. What little we could salvage from the wreck has gone to the families of my drowned men. My finances are reeling from this loss. I have barely enough left to start over.
Still, we have no right to complain. All we lost was some coin and four months of time on this failed journey. My sailors lost their lives.
Of course. Their families need all the help they can get right now.
Kind as ever, [PlayerName]. Even struggling with your own problems, you still open your heart to those in need. Your parents would be proud.
Yzan, I have 5 days to gather 150 silver. Or I lose my home.
How much?! Damn, that’s right, you haven't been able to make payments on your Blood Price while we were gone. You always get the short end of the stick, don't you?
This Blood Price on your head is disgusting. It's unfair to hold anyone responsible for the crimes of their ancestors. You weren't even born when that tragedy happened!
I welcome the challenge. Besides, it's an excuse to get out there and find adventure.
More like find an early grave and lose a leg. “What doesn't kill you makes you stronger”? My prosthetic arm and leg are a testament to how stupid that sentiment is.
Suffering doesn’t help anyone. Any system that forces pain upon anyone innocent has no right to exist. I often wonder if we're alive because of our tribal laws, or in spite of them.
I know. But I don't have a choice.
Of course you do. Your life is your own. You choose what to do and where to go. Just because a choice is hard doesn't mean you can't take it.
I'm sorry I don't have better news, [PlayerName]. Well, I guess it's up to us to pick up the pieces. Best of luck with squaring things with Rissa in the short term.
I guess I truly am on my own, then...

Actually... I do have a small stash of goods I hid, in case of disaster. I hid it near the old shipwreck to the South. When you open it, remember that the Moon Commands the Stars. You'll know what I mean.
Remember, take care of yourself and don’t be a tool for others, or you’ll end with missing limbs like me. Make your own path.
I want my money back. Hand it over or I'll beat it out of you.
Wait, you're mugging me, [PlayerName]?! The last person in this place that really gives a damn about you? After all the crap we just went through?!
Yeah. I'm mugging you. Now give me what you owe me!
Fine! This is all I have, unless you're interested in a little fishing boat that you don't know how to steer. Take my 25 silver and buy yourself some decency. Get lost, [PlayerName].
I'm sorry, that wasn’t a funny joke.
On any other day, it’d have laughed. But I lost a dozen sailors in this accident. I'm no mood for pranks.
I’ve got work to do, [PlayerName]. But it was good talking to my last friend in this damn town.
Get lost. We're through, [PlayerName].
May Elatt watch over you, [PlayerName]. Can I help you?
Anything I should avoid outside of Cierzo?
Well, for one thing, be wary on the beaches outside. An encounter with a pistol shrimp may prove deadly. There's a reason they're so colorful, it’s to warn other predators away!
Not only are they nasty up close, they boast a deadly ranged attack as well. It’s charged with lightning, so use potions and armor that resist this type of attack if you fight one.
The Chersonese has game animals and plenty of trees for wood. Its water, however, has to be boiled first. Fill your Waterskin at the Water Purifier on the village beach before you head out.
You're a priest of Elatt, right? What can you tell me about him?

As a human, he was far from perfect. He was supposedly brash and full of himself in his younger years. But he strove to improve himself day by day, and founded the Tribe Without Name, governed by the 3 Pillars the Holy Mission still follows.
Then came the Scourge. Elatt, being a master of Magic, sacrificed his very humanity and became Living Thought, guiding us to the uneasy stalemate we’ve known for most of this century.

The Five Winds we once prayed to were capricious. Elatt however... I’ve had the honor of speaking with him. He is very real. Having a god that was once mortal is comforting. He remembers what it was like to wear flesh like we do.
See you Rufus, I have to go.
[PlayerName], always a pleasure! What do you want?
I may have something for you.
Glad to hear that. What do you have?
I'll leave you to your work, thanks for the chat.
Look after yourself, [PlayerName].
I’m looking for work.
I’m looking for something I can do nearby.
Got any more dangerous work for me?
I have something to sell.
I have this unusual item...
I’m here about work.
I found that rare mushroom you wanted!
As a matter of fact, I could use a brash explorer for something. Tell me, what will you risk for some silver?
If the pay’s good, I'm willing to put my life in danger.
I’m not risking my life for coins, if that's what you're asking.
Fair enough. It is a good thing to understand your boundaries. If you find rare items, my coin purse is always open!
I’m looking for a particularly rare mushroom in the shape of a shield. I hear it grows in Blister Burrow, north-east of Cierzo.
You’ll know it if you find it. The primary characteristics are its immense size and red color. Bring me that mushroom and I’ll pay 70 silver for it.
That payment, plus whatever you loot and sell along the way, should be enough to cover your Blood Price. Just be careful in there, that cave is a Troglodyte breeding ground.
Troglodytes and deep dark caves? That sounds like a terrible idea. Pass!
And now you see why I don't want to go either. We are both smarter than we look!
What kind of properties does this mushroom have?
That's a trade secret, [PlayerName]. Maybe I'll tell you later. Are you interested, or not?
Sounds like an adventure. I'll do it!

Perfect! Make sure you have a good weapon, a lantern, and plenty of supplies. It’s a dangerous cave, and you will be putting your life on the line. Don't forget that Trogs have poor eyesight, but fantastic hearing.
To get to Blister Burrow, head out of Cierzo’s main gate, then follow the road to the left. When you get to another fork in the road at a wooden gate, turn left again.
You'll know you're going the right way if you see crude statues made by the troglodytes. The entrance should be just ahead of you, along the hillside.
Anything else?
Ah! That’s what I’m looking for! Thank you, [PlayerName]! You’ve more than earned your reward!
I’m always interested in curiosities. What have you got?
I found this strange garnet in the ribcage of an Ash Giant.
Oho, an interesting piece. I’ll give you 30 silver for that.
Really, only 30? I could get a better price with the Ash Giants for returning this stone, I’m sure.
You drive a hard bargain, my friend. I’ll give you 50 silver, and not a single one more!
No deal.
No deal then. Please reconsider the offer.
Deal, here you go.
A good deal for both of us.
Excellent. A pleasure doing business as always!
At that price, I’ll keep it.
Work, eh? What do you need?
Actually, I don’t think I have anything that’ll interest you, sorry.
Don’t get a lady’s hopes like that! It’s not nice!
I’m all ears, what can you tell me?
I found this strange bullet that someone killed Zephyrien with. Do you know what this is?
I found this very beautiful Halberd. Interested?
Let me see that bullet! Oh my. I... can’t really tell much about it without tools, but... whoever designed this was a tremendously cruel person, and very prepared.

The casing itself is made from carefully forged Tsar Stone. I don’t think it’s possible to get that material back into usable form, though, not with that black poison goop all over it... Tell you what, I’ll buy this off you for 60 silver.
Mofat told me that the poison is distilled blood from an Immaculate. Only the Sorobor Academy would be able to refine something this dangerous.

Did he? He must have been mistaken. Sorobor Academy doesn’t do business with those monsters, and we certainly had no motive to see Zephyrien assassinated. Still... If it is Immaculate’s blood... How does 100 silver for the bullet sound?
I’m with the Holy Mission. I can’t let this get swept under the rug. This needs to be investigated!

Trust me, [PlayerName], I don’t think it’s possible for anyone to find the truth of the matter from outside of our organization. We’re too good at keeping secrets. Give it to me and I’ll take care of it. How does 120 silver interest you?
I don’t want your hush money! I’m keeping this bullet!
Let me see that halberd... Excellent craftsmanship! I know warriors that’d be interested in this. I’ll give you more silver for it than any merchant in Aurai!
Considering Sorobor’s recent scandal with those missing missionaries, I’m not sure handing this over is a good idea.

Ah, yes, heard about that incident. Justice has been served and the people responsible have been dealt with, so I can assure you, giving this to me is quite safe. Of course, I could increase my price to 100 silver... What do you say?
I'm glad you survived the wreck, [PlayerName]. And I'm sorry about your losses. I know how much you were counting on this expedition.
That glowing sword is new. When did you get it?
Rufus commissioned it for me as a going away present. I was going to leave this morning to go join the Holy Mission of Elatt before Mother could stop me.
But with the shipwreck... It wouldn't be right to leave. I have to stay with the tribe until the mourning period is over.
I can't imagine your mother will let you go without another lecture.
I know. Rissa already promised that the second she isn't drowning in important matters, she and I will be having a long talk.
I hope she convinces you. I'll miss you if you leave.
I know. I'll miss you and Yzan too. But this is the path I choose to walk. I'm done letting Rissa decide my life. I want to be part of the greater good, not rule over people.
You should just go now. You're abandoning your name and home anyway. Forget staying for the mourning period.

I would, but... Cierzo's still my home. I can't just leave when it's in such pain. As soon as the mourning period is over, though, I'm leaving. No matter what Mother says. I have delayed for too long already.
You have no idea... I don’t know how I’m going to gather the money Rissa is demanding from me.
I have faith in you, [PlayerName]. You'll pull through. If you can survive such a lethal shipwreck, I'm certain you can make your next Blood Price Payment.
Go, now. We both have work to do, for Cierzo's sake.
Nice to see you, [PlayerName]. You have nothing to fear while I’m around, my friend.
Oh. [PlayerName]. What brings you here? How's my brother doing?
Well, Yzan's alive. That's more than most of the other people on our expedition can say.
Y-yeah, shame about the shipwreck. Accidents like this happen all the time.
Not if the lighthouse is lit. Who was on duty that night?
Not a clue. I’m not the one organizing things around here. Wasn’t me though, that’s for sure.
Well, the bay is pretty dangerous. If it keeps the pirates away, then I guess it's dangerous to our ships too.
Exactly! If my brother had a smaller ship, or you guys hadn't picked up so many Kazite rugs or whatever else in Oroshi, you wouldn't have had any trouble!
Shouldn't you be helping your brother salvage the wreck?
I don't think he wants my help. He's always says that I'm stupid and clumsy. I'd probably just get in the way. Ugh, this is the worst day I've had in forever.
Rise and shine, Trog spawn! You think you can nip off for four months and not pay what you owe the tribe?
A Blood Price is sacred, [PlayerName], you can't just shrug off that responsibility for as long as you did!
If I don't see the money from you by the time I count to ten, you’ll regret you ever came home!
I just woke up from a shipwreck! Have a heart, will you?
You know I can't pay it! All the money we made in Oroshi is at the bottom of the bay!
Yeah, you were on that ship too, weren't you? How many lives must your family be responsible for destroying before enough is enough?! I lost my daughter on that voyage!
This doesn't change the fact that I have no money right now and can't pay you.
Stop this right now. You're being unreasonable. Don't make this violent.
If you can't make the payments you missed, we will seize your home! That ought to cover four months of ignoring your duty to the tribe! Either pay up, or get out of our way!
Enough of this! Twelve people are dead! Stop this shameful behaviour at once! This is a time for the tribe to come together and mourn our lost loved ones, not to demand payment from a survivor!

To threaten someone like this while the lost lives are still fresh is an insult to their memory! [PlayerName] is a victim of that shipwreck too. Under the laws of the Blue Chamber Collective, I have declared a period of mourning. You understand what that means, don't you?
But Chamberlady Aberdeen! [PlayerName] has clearly been-

I said, that is enough! If you want to resume ‘discussions’ with [PlayerName] after the mourning period, feel free. But until then, your concern should be for those whose lives were lost in the wreck.
Oliele, see these people off, would you?
You heard Mother. Away with you, or I will personally see to it that you get double shifts of guard duty this month! Leave [PlayerName] be!
(This corpse bears the uniform of one of Cierzo`s sailors... The wounds suggest that the pistol shrimps got him...)
Thank you again, [PlayerName]! I'll find someplace to recover, then I'll come running home singing your praises! I'll never forget this!
I can't... I can't move... A pistol shrimp got me... I think it tore a hole in my gut... Help... please! Before it comes back!
I don’t have anything that can help. I'll look for something, hang on!
Open your mouth, I have a potion I can use! (Give a health potion.)
Open up, this drink will help you. (Give Gep’s Drink.)
Hold still, I have a bandage! (Give a Bandage.)
Please... hurry... I don't know how long I have...
I... can feel it working... Thank Elatt! I'm not going to die here!
What... did you just give me? I need medicine, not... Oh wow. My vision is already clearing up! Whatever that was, it's incredible!
Oh! It's you, [PlayerName]! Thank you! A million times thank you! I seriously owe you one! I'll talk to Aunt Rissa, and make sure you get a full Tribal Favor for this!
Ow... I don't think I'm fit to run back home just yet. I'll go find a safe place to let that medicine do its thing, then go home the second I'm able.
Hello there. I’m just mentoring this smith. He’s good at what he does, but a little help from me will push him to greatness!
Don’t mind the lines of light all over. That happens when you reach the rank of Disciple in the Holy Mission. With these, I can resist and destroy Corruption with my very body!

Hmph, you look tough enough. How’s the outside world, adventurer? It’s been years since I left Abrassar. Mother thinks I’m an embarrassment at major meetings. Why don’t you tell me all about your travels sometime over drinks, on me?

I’m afraid I don’t have time for you. I have a lot on my mind. Being next in line for the throne is a full-time job. I have to be completely up to date on everything that could affect the Kingdom, and I have to watch my back at all times. It’s exhausting.
[PlayerName]! You're alive! You must be freezing. Come, warm up by the fire, before you freeze to death!
You look like you’re about to collapse from thirst. There’s a clean spring by the broken bridge you just crossed. Have a drink before you faint!
You found some rags on the beach? Good. Wear them. They’ll keep you warmer than nothing!
You’ll catch a cold if you wander around without any clothes. Here, they’re not much, but wear them.
Where are we, Yzan? The last thing I remember was our ship hitting a rock...
We're not far from home. You can see the lighthouse from here, can't you? Eto made it out too, he's making his way home to Cierzo to go get help.
Eto made it out alive too? Thank Elatt.
He’s a Kazite, [PlayerName], he was born on a ship. This probably isn’t the first time he’s had to survive a shipwreck.
One of my men went to look for survivors out near that arch. He hasn't come back yet... I'm worried he might have run into hyenas. If you're well enough, can you look for him?
If you’re still feeling too injured from the shipwreck, go ahead and sleep in one of the bedrolls I laid out, and I’ll keep watch for Eto and rescuers.
You look half-starved! Help yourself to the bread in the basket behind me. There's also plenty of Gaberries growing around here if you’re still hungry afterwards.
“If you survived the wreck, meet me on the hill ahead, I’m setting up a camp for us. I'll try to leave essentials next to these markers.”
“Dry up and stay warm with these rags. The cold could kill you if you don't bundle up.”
“I've left a waterskin if you need water. There's clean water around here if you need to refill it.”
“If you’re injured, there's a bandage for you. You can make more from Linen Cloths.”

“[InputAction_LockToggle] to lock on a target. [InputAction_Attack1] for attacks. [InputAction_Attack2] for heavy attacks. Tap [InputAction_Dodge] to dodge, hold to run. [InputAction_Block] to block.”
Can you teach me how to fight?
What do you want me to teach you?
How do I focus on my targets?
Lock on enemies to circle around them in melee or to attack foes with bows or spells.
How do I actually fight?
You can combo attacks. Heavy attacks are slower but stronger. Performing a heavy attack at different points in a combo performs different attacks. Attacks take stamina to perform.
What’s the best way to prevent taking hits from enemies?
When the enemy bears down on you, dodge to get out of harm's way. If your foe is quick, you may want to drop your backpack. Most backpacks slow down your roll.
Blocking will protect you from enemy physical attacks, but every hit you block will consume stamina. To block projectiles, you must use a shield. Against magical explosions, you will need to dodge.
If you need to get into a better position or to flee, sprint away. Take care not to run for too long, or you will be too exhausted to fight.
How should I protect myself?
Some foes will do more than just strike at you with swords or claws. They might harm you with ice, fire, lightning or more. Wear equipment that resists the type of damage they inflict.

Every blow you take will destabilize you. If you take too many hits in a short time, you may be knocked off your feet. If you are being harried too hard, try to get some distance from your foe and regain your footing.
Likewise, if you manage to make your opponent stumble, press your advantage. Blunt weapons are an excellent choice to use this strategy.
How do I sneak around unseen?

First, you’ll have better chance of avoiding attention if you’re in the dark. Then, put out any lit lanterns or torches and crouch down. Stay out of your enemy’s vision, and either sneak past them, or carefully approach them to attack.
You can use this stealthy approach to set up traps for your enemies, or to get the first strike with a melee weapon, or to backstab them if you’ve learned the right dagger skill.
Traps are powerful when you bait enemies into them. First, you need a trigger device like a tripwire, then you need to arm it with a compatible item like iron spikes.
You’re a healer, right? What should I be worried about in the wild?
Do you have any specific questions?
What short term situations could make me lose the edge in a fight?
Many foes will infect you with temporary effects. These effects go away over time, although many can be cured with the right items.
For example, if you are bleeding and losing health, a bandage will stop the bleeding and heal you for a short while.
What do I do if I catch a disease?

You can brew or buy various types of tea to begin the recovery process. To make your own in the wild, you’ll need the ingredients and a cooking pot, though. After drinking, you’ll need some time before the illness is actually cured.

If those options are unavailable, just rest for a long time. Have lots of water, sleep and food, and eventually you will beat back the disease. Depending on what you caught, it may take several days before you are well again.
Can you teach me about how to eat well, while I’m in the wild?
I’ve got you covered. What’s on your mind?
I’m not sure how to find food out there.

On top of hunting, you can forage for food. Pick Gaberries from bushes or use a Fishing Harpoon at a fishing spot. Cook any raw meat and boil any water that isn't "clean" before eating. You don't want to get sick.
What’s a quick and easy way to cook?
Simple food can be cooked on a lit campfire. Cooked food rots slower and fills you up more. You can even boil River Water to turn it into Clean Water that is free of disease.
I want to try my hand at more advanced dishes.

If you deploy a cooking pot over a campfire, or if you have a home with a proper kitchen, you’ll be able to cook recipes with more than one ingredient. They’ll be even more filling and often have special properties. A good meal before a fight will tilt the odds in your favor.
Can you teach me about magic?
I could wax poetic about it all day. What’s got your curiosity?
What actually is Mana, and how do you control it?
Mana is energy that flows through everything. Plants, animals, people, even rocks. Mages are those who’ve learned how to capture that energy and unleash it in the form of magic spells.
Magic is something that requires patience to master. By combining spells in the right sequence, you will achieve better results than using a spell on its own.
Where can I learn magic?

To unlock the secret of Mana, you must travel to a Ley Line, a place where Aurai's life flows strong. The nearest one is the one under the Conflux Mountain. You know it, right? The large purple mountain in the Chersonese.
The Holy Mission and the Kingdom of Levant have their own paths into the Conflux Mountain as well, and each one will test you differently. They’ll all lead to the main chamber.
What do I need to learn to survive in the wild?
What’s got you worried?
I’ve noticed that the longer I stay out, the less maximum health and stamina I have.
Pay attention to what your body tells you. As you push yourself, your maximum reserves of Health and Stamina will be diminished, and you'll only have a fraction of your maximum.

Sleeping in a tent or a bed will restore your reserves of Stamina and Health. Always be mindful of your limits and don't push them more than you need. There is no shame in taking time to set up camp when you are exhausted.
How important is it to eat, drink and sleep?
Your body has needs. Hunger, thirst and exhaustion are persistent foes, so eat and drink when you need to. With a little preparation, you will find it easy enough to take care of yourself.
Rest is the best remedy for a wounded body. If your reserves of Health and Stamina are diminished or you are gravely injured, it’s a good idea to rest in a bedroll or a tent.
If you're near civilization, a night at the inn will take care of your needs. It will cost a handful of silver, though.
How do I deal with dangerous temperatures?
